title: pytest raises error in doc-string
body:
### Checklist

- [X] I have searched the [existing issues](https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues) for similar issues.
- [X] I added a very descriptive title to this issue.
- [X] I have provided sufficient information below to help reproduce this issue.

### Summary

I tested the default example described in the [documentation](https://docs.streamlit.io/develop/concepts/app-testing/get-started) for testing an app.

Importing `from streamlit.testing.v1 import AppTest` at the beginning of the file resulted in two errors with the same error message `invalid escape sequence '\.'`. These errors occur in the doc-string of the file
- `elements/lib/column_types.py`
   -  line 535 `\.` occurs twice
   -  line 536 `\h` also raises an similar error `invalid escape sequence '\h'` 
- `elements/widgets/button.py` 
   - line 478 `\.` occurs there as well which raises the same error

### Reproducible Code Example

_No response_

### Steps To Reproduce

_No response_

### Expected Behavior

The example of the documentation should pass.

### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this used to work in a previous version.

### Debug info

- Streamlit version: 1.33.0
- Python version: 3.10.11
- Operating System: Ubuntu 23.10
- Browser:


### Additional Information
As a minimal example
```python
def test_addition():
    """Additiond test `\.`."""
    assert 1 + 0 == 1
```
results in the  same error, so this error gets raised by the way the doc string is written in streamlit.
